title: Quiz 8: Data Collection
description: Instruments, interviews, observation, and data quality.

questions.question: Which data collection method involves reviewing existing documents to save time and money?
questions.explanation: Reviewing existing records saves time and money by using available data.
questions.hint: Think about using already available data.

questions.question: A structured interview schedule allows for flexibility and in-depth probing by the researcher.
questions.explanation: Structured interviews are rigid; Semi-structured or unstructured allow flexibility.

questions.question: Match the question type to its description.

pairs.right: No preset alternatives, freedom of response

questions.explanation: Open-ended has freedom, Closed-ended has alternatives, Contingency follows up, Matrix shares categories.
questions.hint: Think about the structure of each question type.

questions.question: What are the advantages of Focus Group Discussions? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Suitable for highly sensitive personal issues

questions.explanation: Focus groups are efficient and generate dialogue through group influence. They're hard to control and not suitable for sensitive issues.

questions.question: The process of keying data into a computer for analysis is called Data ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Data entry is the process of keying data into a computer.
questions.hint: Think about typing data into a computer.

questions.question: Which observation method involves the researcher watching from the outside without interfering?
questions.explanation: Non-participatory observation involves watching without interfering.
questions.hint: Think about observing from the outside.

questions.question: Order the stages of data processing.
questions.explanation: Stages: Decide format → Design code → Code data → Data entry → Data cleaning.
questions.hint: Start with planning how to organize data.

questions.question: Using 'leading' questions in a questionnaire is recommended to help the respondent answer correctly.
questions.explanation: Leading questions bias the results and should be avoided.

questions.question: What is the main disadvantage of a mailed questionnaire?
questions.explanation: Mailed questionnaires typically have low response rates.
questions.hint: Think about people not responding to mail.

questions.question: What type of question is this: 'Do you smoke? Yes/No. If Yes, how many per day?'
questions.explanation: This is a contingency or filter question.
questions.hint: Think about questions that depend on previous answers.
